text: ‘dayāl nitāi chaitanya’ bo’le nāch re āmār man
nāch re āmār man, nāch re āmār man
translation: Oh my mind, just dance! Oh my mind, just dance! Oh my mind, please dance, chanting, “Dayāl Nitāi Chaitanya!”

text: (emon dayāl to nāi he, mār kheye prema dey)
takhon kṛṣṇa-nāme ruchi habe, ghuchibe bandhan
translation: Such a merciful personality as Nityānanda Prabhu is not to be found anywhere. He suffers a beating from Jagāi and Mādhāi and still gives them love of God.

When you become offenceless, you will obtain love of God; but in these Names of Chaitanya and Nitāi there is no consideration of offences. Once you have a taste for the Holy Name of Krishna, bondage to this world will come to an end.

text: tokhon anāyāse saphal habe jīvera jīvan
translation: When there is attachment to the Holy Name of Krishna, then, very easily, the life of a living being becomes successful. Without attachment to Krishna, life is simply false. If the mercy of Lord Gaura is there, then at the end of life you will obtain the beautiful vision of Rādhā and Śyāma in Vṛndāvan.
